meanings.definition: To separate or divide into parts or fractions.
meanings.sent1: The chef will fractionate the cake into equal slices for the party guests.
meanings.sent2: The machine fractionates the mixture into its individual components.
meanings.sent3: I tried to fractionate my time between work and play, but it was challenging.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter fractionates the silence in the room like a burst of colorful confetti.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush fractionates the canvas, creating a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To undergo a process of fractionation.
meanings.sent1: The liquid fractionates when heated, separating into different layers.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the solution fractionates into distinct substances.
meanings.sent3: The old clock seemed to fractionate time itself, ticking irregularly.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, the crowd seemed to fractionate into different dancing groups.
meanings.sent5: The clouds fractionate in the sky, forming unique shapes with the wind.
